cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 210 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the northern Yucatan Peninsula, then turning north-northeast across the Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana or the Mississippi Gulf Coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are possible at Mobile with a 38 % chance of sustained 34-kt winds and an 11 % chance of 50-kt winds during the middle of Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 2–4 ft storm surge in and near Mobile Bay if the center tracks just west of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 6 inches could cause flash or urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes possible in outer rain bands during Wednesday.
